Package sudoku

Interface SudokuSolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Sudoku
    public interface SudokuSolver

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Clears all positions in the sudoku.
      void clearNumber​(int r, int c)
      Clears number at position r, c.
      default int getDimension()
      Returns the dimension of the grid
      int[][] getMatrix()
      Returns the numbers in the grid.
      int getNumber​(int r, int c)
      Returns the number in box r,c.
      boolean isAllValid()
      Checks that all filled in numbers are valid according to sudoku rules.
      boolean isValid​(int r, int c, int nbr)
      Checks if number at position r, c is valid according to Sudoku rules.
      void setMatrix​(int[][] nbrs)
      Fills the grid with the numbers in nbrs.
      void setNumber​(int r, int c, int nbr)
      Sets the number nbr in box r, c.
      boolean solve()
      Recursive algorithm that tries to solve sudoku.

    • Method Detail

      • setNumber

        void setNumber​(int r,
               int c,
               int nbr)
        Sets the number nbr in box r, c.
        Parameters:
        r - The row
        c - The column
        nbr - The number to insert in box r, c
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r or c is outside [0..getDimension()-1] or number is outside [1..9]

      • getNumber

        int getNumber​(int r,
              int c)
        Returns the number in box r,c. If the box i empty 0 is returned.
        Parameters:
        r - The row
        c - The column
        Returns:
        the number in box r,c or 0 if the box is empty.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r or c is outside [0..getDimension()-1]

      • clearNumber

        void clearNumber​(int r,
                 int c)
        Clears number at position r, c.
        Parameters:
        r - The row
        c - The column
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if r or c is outside [0...getDimension()-1]

      • isValid

        boolean isValid​(int r,
                int c,
                int nbr)
        Checks if number at position r, c is valid according to Sudoku rules.
        Parameters:
        r - The row
        c - The column
        nbr - The number to check
        Returns:
        true if number is valid else false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException() - if r or c is outside [0..getDimension()-1] or number is outside [1..9]

      • isAllValid

        boolean isAllValid()
        Checks that all filled in numbers are valid according to sudoku rules.
        Returns:
        true if all numbers are valid, else false.

      • solve

        boolean solve()
        Recursive algorithm that tries to solve sudoku.
        Returns:
        true if sudoku was solvable else false.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all positions in the sudoku.

      • getMatrix

        int[][] getMatrix()
        Returns the numbers in the grid. An empty box i represented by the value 0.
        Returns:
        the numbers in the grid

      • setMatrix

        void setMatrix​(int[][] nbrs)
        Fills the grid with the numbers in nbrs.
        Parameters:
        nbrs - the matrix with the numbers to insert
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nbrs have wrong dimension or containing values not in [0..9]

      • getDimension

        default int getDimension()
        Returns the dimension of the grid
        Returns:
        the dimension of the grid
